channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 4 potholes, 20th February
item.description:
This has been here for considerable amount of time and has returned after repair a few years back

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Kimberley Drive, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Abandoned Mattress and other furniture, 20th February
item.description:
Old abandoned mattress and other furniture obstructing pedestrian walkway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Amunds Close, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty under bike rack, 20th February
item.description:
Under bike racks has mud / wee / faeces and is never cleaned. Disgusting to lock bikes there every day. Many bike racks have old bikes locked to them which are never removed. Needs fully cleaning / new bike racks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Green Road, West Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge quantity of rubbish along the Phantom Peak building, 20th February
item.description:
The rubbish might be on a private property. HOWEVER, the area is not fenced and it is visible from the public space. It is a complete disgrace that affects everyone walking on Canada street and especially local residents who shouldn't suffer this. As a local resident, there's not much I can do. So I'm asking my Councillor to solve this issue. Thank you P.S. There is also graffiti on the walls which must be removed

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canada Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dark upright steel girder on left coming from shopping centre. Walked smack into it as lights not working. Scary. Also on the left corner by the river, the bricks are still uneven. The tree has been cut down the bricks are still not sorted. It’s very uneven and a Trip hazard. Thank you., 20th February
item.description:
See above. Please fix lights on this bit. It’s very scary Also the bricks on the path are still very uneven because of tree roots. The tree has been cut down for the pavement is still very uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elder Walk, Ladywell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking bike stand on pavement, 20th February
item.description:
Could you arrange for removal of this pile of stuff which is starting to block the pavement, is attached to a bike stand and appears to be somebody’s personal storage area.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gayhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cabinet dumped on street, 20th February
item.description:
Could you please collect this cabinet and bedding that was dumped.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Birkenhead surface and pothole just before bus stop, 20th February
item.description:
This defect was badly ‘repaired’ only a few days ago and has broken up already. The repair was obviously not inspected. Contractors should be made to rectify this without charge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartford Road, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous collapsed manhole cover, 20th February
item.description:
This is extremely dangerous and I witnessed vehicles slopping into this. I can’t imagine cyclist. This needs to be fixed as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honor Oak Road, Forest Hill, Greater London

item.title: Car damaged - Hit and Run by Ford Black pick up truck, 20th February
item.description:
Hi, Owner of the Ford Black pick up truck, please come forward so we can come to a resolution. Incidence: Time/Date: Tuesday 17th @4.51pm We have evidence already Resident of Sandpit Place

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandpit Place, Charlton

item.title: There are a series of potholes, situated between Derwent Crescent and Green Road, N20, 20th February
item.description:
These potholes have been there for several months. in my opinion, the whole stretch needs resurfacing. you resurfaced the whole area south of this last year, but missed this stretch out, since then it has gotten much worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Britannia Road, Finchley, Greater London
